parameters.text: (Optional) Selects rows from the specified dataset based on this filter condition.
A query is made up of statements. Each statement begins by identifying the input stream, like "q." This query uses the following types of statements:
Ask Your Data Questions with SAQL Queries

When you create a table or chart in the explorer, Analytics writes the underlying SAQL query for you.

You can use SAQL to create new fields based on calculations on existing fields. Use the navigation on the left to see some common SAQL use cases!

You can use bindings inside a SAQL query to dynamically set a component, like grouping and filter.
Behind every top performer...is a query that proves they're the best! Scroll down to see how SAQL powers this chart of top performers
Just getting started? Get to know  the basics of SAQL by seeing the query underlying this simple chart.

What is the query doing? Identifying and loading the dataset, setting filters, grouping by a field, performing calculations, setting sort order and limit. Those are the basics, but there's a whole world beyond that, full of math, logic, statistics, and more. Knowing these building blocks will unlock the door.
SAQL is the Salesforce Analytics Query Language that fetches and process the data in Einstein Analytics. You can even use the SAQL editor to write your own queries.
(Required) Returns the results of the specified expressions as output fields.
(Optional) Groups records that have matching values for the specified field.
(Optional) Limits the number of results that are returned.
(Optional) Sorts the data in ascending or descending order.
